Home / Issues / Environment / Caring for Climate: Global Business Leadership Platform on Climate Change

Caring for Climate:  The Business Leadership Platform

Business side-event at United Nations Climate Conference COP15 Conference
12 December 2009, Copenhagen, Denmark  

Convened by the Copenhagen Climate Council, in cooperation with UN Global Compact, the event will take place at the Kronborg Castle, North of Copenhagen.

[ More information]


Second Meeting of Caring for Climate Signatories
7-8 April 2010, Geneva, Switzerland  

Convened by the UN Global Compact in cooperation with the Copenhagen Climate Council, the second meeting of the Caring for Climate Signatories will take place at UN Headquarters in Geneva.

[ More information]

List of Signatories | Meetings and Events | Guidance Material

"Caring for Climate" is a voluntary and complementary action platform for UN Global Compact participants who seek to demonstrate leadership on the issue of climate change. It provides a framework for business leaders to advance practical solutions and help shape public policy as well as public attitudes. Chief executive officers who support the statement are prepared to set goals, develop and expand strategies and practices, and to publicly disclose emissions as part of their existing disclosure commitment within the UN Global Compact framework, that is, the Communication on Progress.

Caring for Climate is a unique initiative – a commitment to action by business and a call to governments, incorporating transparency. It offers an interface for business and governments at the global level, with the potential of rapidly becoming the leading platform for pragmatic business solutions -- transcending national interests and responding to the global nature of the issue at stake. Moreover, the broad geographical spread of its supporters, involving both leading actors from developed and emerging economies, reinforces the novel nature of this engagement platform.

How to Endorse Caring for Climate

The Global Compact is inviting all business participants to join Caring for Climate by signing the Caring for Climate statement below. It is hoped that a significant number of business leaders will support the Statement, thereby expressing the urgent need for businesses, governments and citizens to take steps to address climate change. Companies supporting the Statement will be recognized on the UN Global Compact website and in the report of actions taken by signatories. A company’s decision to endorse the Statement follows the Global Compact’s established leadership model and requires CEO-level support. To indicate your support for the Statement, please send an email to climatechange@unglobalcompact.org indicating your endorsement.

Climate Change: Is Business Doing Enough?

In an op-ed published on the COP15 website, Georg Kell urges business to demonstrate more leadership on climate issues.

Key Documents

  • Caring for Climate Statement
    >> (pdf)  Arabic | Chinese | English | French | Russian | Spanish

  • Brochure Caring for Climate
    >> (pdf)  English | Chinese

  • Letter of Invitation to Join Caring for Climate

  • Explanatory Note to the Caring for Climate Statement

  • Caring for Climate Series: Transformation is Possible

On the occasion of the World Business Summit on Climate Change in Copenhagen in May 2009, UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon has launched the Caring for Climate Series, a collection of new research studies and reports by leading investment, academic and civil society organizations. The following six reports offer a broad range of perspectives on the roles of business, investors and governments in tackling climate change:

  • Best Practices and Policy Frameworks: 2009 Survey of Caring for Climate Signatories  

  • Emissions Reduction and Low Carbon Intensity: Are We Making Progress? 

  • Change is Coming: A Framework for Climate Change - A Defining Issue of the 21st Century 

  • Investor Leadership on Climate Change: An Analysis of the Investment Community's Role and Snapshot of Recent Activity 

  • Building a Green Recovery 

  • Carbon Markets - the Simple Facts

Additional Documents

  • Case Story: Climate Neutral Enterprises
  • Green Meeting Guide
